hadiths.text: Thumama (i. e. Ibn Hazn al-Qushairi) reported:I met 'A'isha and asked her about Nabidh (that was served to the Holy Prophet). 'A'isha called an Abyssinian maid (servant) and said: Ask her (about it) for it was he, who prepared the Nabidh for the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). The Abyssinian (maid-servant) said: I prepared Nabidh for him in a waterskin in the night and tied its mouth and then suspended it; and when it was morning he (the Holy Prophet) drank from it

chapter.ara-name: باب إِبَاحَةِ النَّبِيذِ الَّذِي لَمْ يَشْتَدَّ وَلَمْ يَصِرْ مُسْكِرًا
chapter.eng-name: The permissibility of Nabidh so long as it has not become strong and has not become intoxicating
